events.originalText: The first episode of the documentary series Benefits Street aired on Channel 4, prompting discussion in the United Kingdom about welfare dependency.
events.subtitle: Benefits Street
events.headline: Benefits Street documentary sparks welfare dependency discussion in the UK

events.originalText: Two-time American Olympic figure-skating medalist Nancy Kerrigan  was hit on the leg with a police baton by an assailant hired by the ex-husband of her rival Tonya Harding.
events.subtitle: Figure skating
events.headline: Nancy Kerrigan attacked with police baton by assailant hired by Tonya Harding's ex-husband

events.originalText: National Airlines Flight 2511, traveling from New York City to Miami, exploded in mid-air due to a bomb placed by an unknown party, resulting in the deaths of all 34 people on board.
events.subtitle: National Airlines Flight 2511
events.headline: National Airlines Flight 2511 explodes mid-air, killing all 34 on board

events.originalText: The inaugural Asian Socialist Conference, an organisation of socialist political parties, opened in Rangoon with 177 delegates, observers and fraternal guests.
events.subtitle: Asian Socialist Conference
events.headline: Asian Socialist Conference opens in Rangoon with 177 delegates

events.originalText: During his State of the Union address, U.S. president Franklin D. Roosevelt presented his Four Freedoms as fundamental freedoms that all people ought to enjoy.
events.subtitle: State of the Union
events.headline: Franklin D. Roosevelt presents Four Freedoms in State of the Union address

events.originalText: German geophysicist Alfred Wegener presented his theory of continental drift, the precursor of plate tectonics.
events.subtitle: Alfred Wegener
events.headline: Alfred Wegener presents theory of continental drift

events.originalText: Italian educator Maria Montessori (pictured) opened her first school and day-care centre for working-class children in Rome, employing a philosophy of education that now bears her name.
events.subtitle: Maria Montessori
events.headline: Maria Montessori opens first school in Rome for working-class children

events.originalText: The worst storm to impact Ireland in 300 years damaged or destroyed more than 20 per cent of houses in Dublin with 100-knot (190 km/h) winds.
events.subtitle: Night of the Big Wind
events.headline: Worst storm in 300 years hits Ireland, damaging over 20% of houses in Dublin

events.originalText: Sie werden aus Saba alle kommen, a Bach cantata for Epiphany, was first performed in Leipzig.
events.subtitle: Sie werden aus Saba alle kommen, BWV 65
events.headline: Bach cantata Sie werden aus Saba alle kommen first performed in Leipzig

events.originalText: King Henry VIII of England married his fourth wife, Anne of Cleves; the marriage was annulled six months later.
events.subtitle: Henry VIII
events.headline: King Henry VIII marries fourth wife, Anne of Cleves, annulled six months later

events.originalText: The oldest European school of higher learning in the Americas, the Colegio de Santa Cruz, was founded in Tlatelolco, Mexico City.
events.subtitle: Colegio de Santa Cruz de Tlatelolco
events.headline: Oldest European school in the Americas founded in Tlatelolco, Mexico City

events.originalText: Four years before the fall of Constantinople, Constantine XI Palaiologos (pictured) assumed the throne as the last Byzantine emperor.
events.subtitle: Fall of Constantinople
events.headline: Constantine XI Palaiologos becomes last Byzantine emperor before fall of Constantinople

events.originalText: Stefan Dečanski was crowned King of Serbia, succeeding his half-brother Stefan Konstantin, whom he later defeated in battle.
events.subtitle: Stefan Dečanski
events.headline: Stefan Dečanski crowned King of Serbia, defeating his half-brother Stefan Konstantin

events.originalText: Harold Godwinson, the last Anglo-Saxon monarch before the Norman Conquest, was crowned King of England.
events.subtitle: Harold Godwinson
events.headline: Harold Godwinson crowned King of England before Norman Conquest
